page.title: 06Llwyndyrys Mansion
page.content: Near Llwyndyry there is a historic mound which is marked Tumulus on the Ordance Survey Map but according to Sir John Lynn thomas' researh was the site of the headquarters of a Welsh chieftain who entertained Pwyll Pendefig Dyfed on his famous historic hunt from Arberth to Glyn Cuch when he stayed at Llwyn Dirawyd (Llwyndyrys) as recalled in the Mabinogion. It is also believed that the Battle of Llechryd 1087 took place at Llwyndyrys when Rhys ap Tewdwr gained a victory. it was owned by the Bishops of St David's until 1800 when it was sold to Rev T Griffiths under an act of parliament for the redemption of land tax. The Mansion eventually became a hotel. The present owner mrs N Sear runs it a a hotel during the summer months but in the winter more emphasis is placd on the functions side.
